title: Installation issue: gcc+nvptx
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

There seems to be a problem building gcc with nvptx support due to a recent change in the CUDA package.

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->

```console
$ spack install gcc@9.3.0+nvptx
...
 >> 34532    configure: error: CUDA driver package required for nvptx support
..
 >> 34535    make[1]: *** [configure-target-libgomp] Error 1
```

### Information on your system

$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.4
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-skylake_avx512

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

This looks to be due to the following commit which excludes the stubs directory from the CUDA library path:

https://github.com/spack/spack/commit/54bce00d4dd606b20f8b6ad1efad58d2fc0fddeb

I suspect that configure is looking for libcuda.so which is not included in the runtime libraries (it comes with the driver) but there is a stub present.

I can build correctly using the previous version of the CUDA package.py 

@michaelkuhn - I'm not sure if this should be considered a GCC issue or a CUDA one but the commit by @haampie mentioned above isn't daft as far as CUDA itself goes. 

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
